info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 6:41PM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
At 640 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Coldwater to near Redkey. Movement was northeast at 10 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Portland, Redkey, Westchester, Center, Salamonia, Brice, Como, Bellfountain, College Corner, Boundary City, Liber, Blaine, Collett, Bluff Point, Powers, New Mount Pleasant, and Trinity.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. There is a report of a landspout out of Randolph county and this does fit the pattern.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CENTRAL JAY COUNTY THROUGH 715 PM EDT
